New Records: Cape Verde won 3-0 against Mozambique in the Africa Cup 2024 match, marking a significant victory.
Bébé scored the first goal for Cape Verde at minute 32', Ryan Mendes scored at minute 51', and Kevin Pina at minute 69'.
Key Match Events: Cape Verde scored three goals, with the last one coming at minute 69' by Kevin Pina.
Mozambique had a corner kick at minute 85' after Logan Costa's clearance.
Cape Verde's substitution saw Steven Moreira come on and Garry Rodrigues leave the field at minute 80'.
Cape Verde led 1-0 at halftime with possession at 54.9% and 3 shots on target.
Mozambique had a free-kick opportunity at minute 30' after a foul by Jamiro Monteiro on Geny Catamo.
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde and Mozambique had met four times since 2014, with Cape Verde dominating two wins to one draw and one Mozambique win.
Cape Verde was in first place in group B with three points before the match, while Mozambique was third with one point.
Key players to watch included Jamiro Monteiro for Cape Verde and Witi for Mozambique.
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde's coach Pedro Leitao Brito praised the team's performance and resilience after the victory.
Mozambique's coach Francisco Conde expressed frustration with the result but acknowledged Cape Verde's strong performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Stade Félix Houphouët Boigny in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, with a capacity of approximately 40,000 spectators.
The refereeing team included Jean Jacques Ndala Ngambo.
Others: The match was available to watch on Fubo Sports Network and ViX, with VAVEL providing live updates and analysis.
